turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: ... I was seventeen, I loved her so much I tried to die for her. Two years later I couldn't even remember her name!  Let me tell you, time erases everything!

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I don't want to erase anything.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: You'd rather think about it and make yourself miserable?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: ... Yes.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: I give you this.  You're stubborn... Dumb, but stubborn.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Anybody can have a bad day!

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I've had many... when the sea doesn't want you.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: It's never the sea!  It's Roberto, Mamma, that stupid actress... Oh shit!  Jacques, what do you know?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Enzo, Enzo!  Congratulations!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Thank you, thank you very much!

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: That's good.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Enzo, don't be angry.  I was lucky... that's all.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: ... How long was I asleep?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Long enough to die.  Listen, if you really want to die, that's your problem, but don't do it under my nose, okay?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: I'm concentrating.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: We can't dive anymore.  They want to cancel the competition for a while.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: It's not safe, they say.  The doctors say it isn't possible to go deeper and live.  Free diving is over as a sport.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: You say that because you have the title!

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: No!  I would never cheat you.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Well that's very nice of you.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: You were right.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: ... I was right about what?

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: ... It is much better down there. It's a better place.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: ... Push me back in the water...

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I can't.

turns.speaker: ENZO
turns.text: Jacques, take me back down... Please.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Don't you have a heater?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Yeah... Sure... Is this your first trip to Peru?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Does anybody live to make a second?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: A drink to warm up?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Yes, thank you.  Intravenous if possible.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Tea... or whiskey?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: ... both.  Did I just see a man in a red suit and goggles?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Would it be out of place to ask what he's doing?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: The guy in the Halloween suit!

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I recognize you.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: We saw each other a little while ago.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: In the lake?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: No... in the hut.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Please, have a seat.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Thank you.  I wouldn't want to interrupt anything.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: But what brought you to Sicily?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I was doing an insurance investigation in Palermo.  I work for an insurance company.  So, I decided to take a few days off.  I don't know this island at all. It really is gorgeous.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: No, no.  You'll like it.  It's superb.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: ... Okay.  I'll try.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Thanks for helping with the bag.  It looks great!

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I thought it was a nice place.  Isn't it?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I'm being a pain in the ass.  It's beautiful here.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: You're going to be very busy these days aren't you?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I don't know... why?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Just because... I would have liked to visit the town... See the coast... I don't know anybody... Expect for you.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Yes... Maybe... I don't know.  I don't like competitions... It ruins the fun.  Don't you think?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I guess... But you know... I'm American and I've mostly been taught to be competitive... There's always pleasure of being the best?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Maybe on earth there is one... but not when you dive... You see, to dive deep into the sea, for no reason... just to do it.  It's a feeling... I don't know how to say this... Voluptuous?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I thought you'd be at the dinner.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: It's too loud for me.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: You look adorable.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Thank you...

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: ... Especially the sneakers.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Please move slowly, you're rocking the boat.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Lucky I was there to save you.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: You jumped in?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Only to help the medics, I assure you.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: My wallet.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: No.  I want to show you.  Is it ruined?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Well, water isn't exactly the best thing for pictures... Not even for pictures of dolphins...

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Give it to me.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Just checking up on your family.  I guess I was drunker than I thought and the idea of going back to my hotel in a wet dress... Well...

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I'm glad you stayed.  Thank you.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I'd better get back now.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: You... You wouldn't want to spend the day with me?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: No?  Huh?  Yes, of course!!

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: How can you tell it's a female?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: ... The way she moves.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: She's not like the others.  She can't stand to be away from the sea.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: How do you know that?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I don't know, I just feel it.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Can I come watch you dive tomorrow?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Uh... Yes, of course!

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Jacques, you set a world record.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I did?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Aren't you happy?  Don't you feel proud...?  I feel proud and all I did was watch.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I'm going back home.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Because one shouldn't fall in love with creatures from the sea.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I'm not from the sea... I don't understand what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Yes you do.  You know exactly what I'm talking about.  You're afraid I want to hold onto you, and I do, but you're not ready... at least not for me.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: But it's not true, I feel good with you... It feels right...

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: It's me... Johana.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: How are you?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I got fired.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: ... That's funny... I had this job with Enzo... we got fired too.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: So have I.  ... Hello?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I'm still here.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Well, then, talk to me some more.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: ... It's hard you know.  You're so far away and I don't know what else to say.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Then, tell me a story.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Uh... Ah!  A story?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Do you know how it is?  Do you know what you're supposed to do to meet a mermaid?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: No... tell me.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: You go down to the bottom of the sea, where the water isn't even blue anymore, where the sky is only a memory... and you float there, quietly, quietly and stay there...  and you decide that you will die for them... Only then do they start coming out.  They come and greet you and they judge the love you have for them... If it's sincere.  If it's pure... They will be with you and take you away forever.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: It's me again.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I'm being a pain, huh?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: ... Not at all.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Absolutely positive.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Okay.  In that case... I'm at the airport in Nice.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Why did you take me to the hotel, if you live here.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: You'll understand.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Bonjour Monsieur... Louis.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Uncle Louis.  He's a 75 year old amazing guy, isn't he?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I'm very pleased to meet you, Uncle Louis.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: And you?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I didn't dive.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: You'll try again tomorrow?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I don't know... it didn't feel right.  I'm going to bed.  I'm tired.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: ... Nothing.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I'm putting you on the coin... Your essence... That way you'll always be with me when I dive.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Jacques...?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: You go back, I'll walk.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: It's nothing.  Just the long trip. I'm a little jet-lagged.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: You want to lie down for a while?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: No, I'll be fine.  Can you just hand me a glass of water?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: ... When you dive... with that machine... What does it feel like?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: ... The feeling of slipping without falling... The hardest is once you are at the bottom.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Because you have to find a good reason to come back up again... And I always have a hard time finding one.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: You've got to tell me what happened?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I saw how it has to be.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Jacques?  I'm pregnant.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: That's good... that's wonderful. It's wonderful for you.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: You are the father.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Promise me one thing.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Anything.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Promise you won't forget me.

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: Mayol... Mayol... No reservation.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: ... Are you sure?

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: Positive, Sir.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: This is the hotel San Domenico?

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: Yes Sir, and it has been so for 127 years.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Yes, but... So, you haven't got a room left?

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: No Sir, the hotel is full because of the Diving championship.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Ah?!

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: You shouldn't dive everyday, Papa.

turns.speaker: UNCLE LOUIS
turns.text: Then you shouldn't eat everyday, Jacques.

turns.speaker: UNCLE LOUIS
turns.text: Hey!  Have you ever seen a mermaid?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: UNCLE LOUIS
turns.text: Why don't you ask me?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: UNCLE LOUIS
turns.text: Where I saw the mermaids?!  Why don't you ever ask any question? I'm always the one asking the question!  We're sitting here like two stones and I'm taking to myself. Ask me something, Goddamnit!

turns.speaker: UNCLE LOUIS
turns.text: Assassin!

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Uncle Louis, this is my friend Johana.

turns.speaker: UNCLE LOUIS
turns.text: Did you buy the cassettes?  The Wagner, the Berlioz?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: I brought Johana to meet you.

turns.speaker: UNCLE LOUIS
turns.text: Are you crazy?  I have no use for a woman!  Since my accident.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: No, no.  Johana is visiting me.

turns.speaker: UNCLE LOUIS
turns.text: Where are you from, Henrietta?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Johana... New York.

turns.speaker: UNCLE LOUIS
turns.text: What kind of name is that?  To be named after a city?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: He doesn't hear too well.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Uncle Louis!

turns.speaker: UNCLE LOUIS
turns.text: No, no.  It's true.  When I was in New York, oh boy!  Before my accident, you understand?

turns.speaker: UNCLE LOUIS
turns.text: Good.  That way I'll see more of you... Where are you going to stay?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Well... here.

turns.speaker: UNCLE LOUIS
turns.text: In my apartment?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: It's my apartment.

turns.speaker: UNCLE LOUIS
turns.text: Liar!  Thief!  Torturer!  When you were an orphan I nursed you at my breast.

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Uncle Louis, we have a guest!

turns.speaker: UNCLE LOUIS
turns.text: I'm going to put a lock on the telephone.  Did you bring the cassettes?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Uncle Louis, you remember Enzo's mother Signora Molinari from Amorgos?

turns.speaker: UNCLE LOUIS
turns.text: The whale!  How could I forget? Always was something fishy about that woman!

turns.speaker: UNCLE LOUIS
turns.text: What were Italians doing living in Greece anyway?

turns.speaker: JACQUES
turns.text: Louis, we were French!

turns.speaker: UNCLE LOUIS
turns.text: That's different!  What's the matter with you?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I changed the lock you son of a bitch!

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: ... Sally?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You're back!  Hello.  We were burgled.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Again?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: They got the new T.V.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: ... And the new stereo.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I hope they remembered to take the microwave this time?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Yep.  How was your trip...?  Help me clean up, okay?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: You called the police?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: They're going to send detectives.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: How was your trip?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Nice... Very interesting... Great!  ... I guess.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Okay... Who'd you meet?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: It's his heartbeat.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Oh Jesus...!  I'll make some coffee.  They left the stove.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I thought you said he was Peruvian?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Haven't you been listening?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: ... Since eight o'clock last night...!  You're in love.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Don't be a jerk.  There's no such thing as love at first sight.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: ... And if we repaint the walls, we'll need new curtains, you put the painters on you Visa and I'll do the curtains on American Express... for the couch there's Bloomingdales...  or are you still over your limit?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Way past it.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Does that have a hidden meaning?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: No.  I'm just depressed.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You look it too.  You haven't been working out, you haven't been taking your vitamins!  You haven't been drinking your herbs, you haven't been...

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I know, I know!  I'm a terrible person...  It's... I'm so damn, damn sad.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: What is it honey... the frenchy?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Do you think I should have stayed? Don't you think maybe I should have stayed?  I've been a jerk, right?  I should have stayed!  I was supposed to be in love... I was in love!  I am in love, why did I act like a bitch?  He went swimming. All the man did was go swimming! I must be crazy.  It was too good to be true.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Vitamins, exercise, herb tea... and see a doctor, will ya?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: What are they for?

turns.speaker: NOVELLI
turns.text: They're paramedics.  They wait at 180 feet.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: If there was a problem, they could do something right?

turns.speaker: NOVELLI
turns.text: Of course, that's what they're for.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: ... And those?

turns.speaker: NOVELLI
turns.text: Those are the divers who go down 300 to 330 feet.  They dive with a Helium-oxygen mixture.  At that depth, compressed air is too dangerous because it contains carbon dioxide.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: What's that little air bottle on the machine?

turns.speaker: NOVELLI
turns.text: That isn't for the divers actually. It's for the balloon.  It blows up and pulls the diver up like an elevator.  Without it, with the pressure at the bottom, the diver would just stay pinned to the sea bed.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: But doesn't Jacques dive without anything?

turns.speaker: NOVELLI
turns.text: Yes... It's magic.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Who... Who is that?

turns.speaker: LAWRENCE
turns.text: Mayol... Jacques Mayol.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: That's the experiment?  Dumping a guy into a frozen lake?

turns.speaker: LAWRENCE
turns.text: ... The truck fell into a very deep crevasse.  We weren't able to save the equipment.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I'll have to talk to the driver.

turns.speaker: LAWRENCE
turns.text: In the spring when he melts!

turns.speaker: LAWRENCE
turns.text: My dear, science is a cruel mistress.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: But... how is he going to breathe?

turns.speaker: LAWRENCE
turns.text: He isn't going to breathe.

turns.speaker: LAWRENCE
turns.text: He's in the fluoroscope now.  Listen to his heart.  Impressive, huh? The flow of blood is concentrated in the brain and doesn't even feed the limbs anymore.  It's a phenomena that has only been observed with dolphins... until now.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: How long can he stay down?  Without breathing?

turns.speaker: LAWRENCE
turns.text: It depends.  He should come up soon.  Unless he's decided to stay for the night.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Why is he doing this?

turns.speaker: LAWRENCE
turns.text: For one thing, it's his job... as for the rest of it, I wish I knew.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Shouldn't somebody take him a blanket or something?

turns.speaker: LAWRENCE
turns.text: Coffee might be nice.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Will he understand Spanish?

turns.speaker: LAWRENCE
turns.text: His mother's an American.  He spent half of his life in the states. I'd try English if I were you.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Okay, listen, just get the custom's office to send me a copy as fast as possible.  We can't send you new equipment until our file is complete.  Okay?

turns.speaker: LAWRENCE
turns.text: Okay, okay.  You'll have it by the end of the week, how's that?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: You've made me a happy insurance person.

turns.speaker: LAWRENCE
turns.text: Then, goodbye.

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: Wait!  Professor...?

turns.speaker: LAWRENCE
turns.text: ... Yes?

turns.speaker: JOHANA
turns.text: I'll go see how he's doing.

turns.speaker: LAWRENCE
turns.text: Let him sleep.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Alright Mordechai, now that we're alone I just want to say that I'm not happy about this. I don't want a repeat of that incident in the West Bank.

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: I got the job done didn't I? I did what I had to do.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: A settlement completely demolished, ten smashed army jeeps, four dead Arabs. G dash D damn it, Hammer! You think you're above the Ten Commandments? Just find Santa Claus and bring him back to us. No heroics, got it?

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: Hey, it's your Bar Mitzvah. I'm just readin' the Torah portion.

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: I guess I could be chalant about it, but then again I'm not even sure if that's a word. Listen Chief, we could stand around arguing all day, but I gotta case to crack.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: What's your first move?

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: I'm gonna pay a visit to the K.L.F. See if they've got the 411 on Santa's location. I'll check in with you when I know more.

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: Chief, it's me. Listen carefully. I need for the Worldwide Jewish Media Conspiracy to mass produce video copies of every Hollywood movie ever made featuring a positive Jewish protagonist as its lead.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: You mean you want us to make copies of Yentl, Fiddler On The Roof, and Chaim Potok's The Chosen?

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: That'll work. Get them out to the Jewish community stat. We got an epidemic on our hands.

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: It was a trap. I'm back at square one.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Well, then I've got good news for you. We just got word that he'll be making an appearance at the Mall Of America today. I'm sending Esther to meet you there at once.

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: Good thinking. We'll disguise ourselves as a Gentile couple to pass undetected. Now that he thinks I'm dead, this should be a piece of homentashen.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: One last thing Hammer. You take care of yourself. The...

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Mordechai. Thank god you're here.

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: What's up?

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: About an hour ago, we received this transmission from the North Pole.

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: Looks like I got a plane to catch.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Take Esther with you, you'll need the backup.

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: No way, it's too dangerous. Besides, my days of hooking are over.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: So why the long face?

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: It's Esther. Santa's got her.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: My Esther! Oh Mordechai.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Please. Will you help me?

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: I love her sir. If I don't help you, I won't be able to make her my wife. Mohammed Ali Paula Abdul Rahim has agreed to come with me to the North Pole on a rescue mission.

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: There won't be any need for that sir.

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: Hammer, the fate of my daughter rests solely in your hands.

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: I know sir. I won't let you down.

turns.speaker: MRS. CARVER
turns.text: So. Do you have a name?

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: It's Esther.

turns.speaker: MRS. CARVER
turns.text: From the story of Purim.  Well, now that we're all acquainted, let's sit down and start the Sabbath.

turns.speaker: MRS. CARVER
turns.text: You like my Mordechai, yes?

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: He's...he's very nice.  But Mrs. Carver, the fate of Hanukkah rests solely in his hands. Please, you have to help me.

turns.speaker: MRS. CARVER
turns.text: Hanukkah, Shmanukkah. It isn't even one of the high holidays. What concerns me more is that my boychick is almost thirty, and has yet to settle down with a nice Jewish girl.  I'll make you a deal. I'll help you with your little Hanukkah problem if you help me with my Mordechai.

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: What do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: MRS. CARVER
turns.text: He works too much. God forbid he should have a nice Jewish girl come eat by him once in a while. Take his mind off his work. Maybe a blowjob here and there.

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: Well, for starters, we're going to honeymoon in Boca for a week. And then, when we get back, Morty's been talking about taking a stable, good paying job as a consultant for the JDL.

turns.speaker: MRS. CARVER
turns.text: Well, I couldn't be happier for the both of you.

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: Mr. Jefferson Carver?

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: Please, call me Mordechai.

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: From the way she carried herself I could tell she'd been around the block a few times...

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: Sorry I'm late. Traffic was a pisher, and I've been circling the block for the past half hour looking for parking. What are you listening to?

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: Client notes. Sorry.  What can I do for you?

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: My name is Esther. Chief Bloomenbergensteinenthal from the Jewish Defense League desperately needs to speak with you.

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: How is old Chief Bloomenbergensteinenthal? Is he still shtooping every girl he can get his hands on?

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: Actually, his days of marital infidelity have long since past. Now he just shtoops my mother exclusively.

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: Your mother? Oh. Whoops.

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: Mordechai, Santa Claus has been rubbed out by his son Damian. The man's a demon. There's no telling what this new anti semitic psycho Santa is capable of.

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: I'm sorry to hear about Santa. He was a good friend, but my days...

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: Oy vey, I'm stuffed.

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: I don't think I could eat another latke if you paid me.

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: Any sign of Santa?

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: He must be behind that curtain. Relax. We're undercover. We need to give off the appearance of calm. You see Esther, the trick to undercover work is to try and blend in. Act as a Gentile would.

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: What are we going to do? We're at least an hour from the front.

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: C'mon follow me.

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: That got annoying fairly quickly.

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: Yeah, no kidding.

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: So, now what?

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: Now we wait for Santa to make his next move.

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: Want to get a drink?

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: Sure. Why not.

turns.speaker: HAMMER
turns.text: What was that!?

turns.speaker: ESTHER
turns.text: I said, do you come here often!?
